get.description: Lists all of the available Orbital Rest API operations.

200.description: OK. The request has succeeded.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed. If the resource group does not exist, 404 (NotFound) will be returned.

get.description: Returns list of spacecrafts by subscription.

200.description: Request successful. The operation returns a list of spacecraft resources.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed. If the resource group does not exist, 404 (NotFound) will be returned.

get.description: Returns list of spacecrafts by resource group.

200.description: Request successful. The operation returns a list of spacecraft resources.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed. If the resource group does not exist, 404 (NotFound) will be returned.

get.description: Gets the specified spacecraft in a specified resource group.

200.description: Request successful. The operation returns the resulting Spacecraft resource.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description: Creates or updates a spacecraft resource.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: The parameters to provide for the created spacecraft.

200.description: Update successful. The operation returns the resulting spacecraft resource.

201.description: Create successful. The operation returns the resulting spacecraft resource.

Azure-AsyncOperation.description: URL for checking the ongoing status of the operation.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

200.description: Delete successful.

202.description: Accepted and the operation will complete asynchronously.

Location.description: URL for determining when an operation has completed.

204.description: Request successful. Resource does not exist.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameters supplied to update spacecraft tags.

200.description: Update successful. The operation returns the resulting Spacecraft resource.

202.description: Accepted and the operation will complete asynchronously.

Location.description: URL for determining when an operation has completed.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Returns list of contacts by spacecraftName.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed. If the resource group does not exist, 404 (NotFound) will be returned.

201.description: Create successful. The operation returns the resulting contact resource.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

202.description: Accepted and the operation will complete asynchronously.

204.description: Request successful. Resource does not exist.

post.description: Returns list of available contacts. A contact is available if the spacecraft is visible from the ground station for more than the minimum viable contact duration provided in the contact profile.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: The parameters to provide for the contacts.

200.description: Request successful. The operation returns a list of available contacts resources.

202.description: Accepted and the operation will complete asynchronously.

Location.description: URL for determining when an operation has completed.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed. If the resource group does not exist, 404 (NotFound) will be returned.

200.description: Request successful. The operation returns the resulting ContactProfile resource.

provisioningState.description: The current state of the resource's creation, deletion, or modification.

titleLine.description: Title line of the two-line element set (TLE).

tleLine1.description: Line 1 of the two-line element set (TLE).

tleLine2.description: Line 2 of the two-line element set (TLE).

value.description: A list of spacecraft resources in a resource group.

nextLink.description: The URL to get the next set of results.

SpacecraftListResult.description: Response for the ListSpacecrafts API service call.

SpacecraftLink.description: List of authorized spacecraft links per ground station and the expiration date of the authorization.

Spacecraft.description: Customer creates a spacecraft resource to schedule a contact.

port.description: TCP port to listen on to receive data.

EndPoint.description: Customer end point to store and retrieve data during a contact with the spacecraft.

provisioningState.description: The current state of the resource's creation, deletion, or modification.

reservationStartTime.description: Reservation start time of a contact (ISO 8601 UTC standard).

reservationEndTime.description: Reservation end time of a contact (ISO 8601 UTC standard).

rxStartTime.description: Receive start time of a contact (ISO 8601 UTC standard).

rxEndTime.description: Receive end time of a contact (ISO 8601 UTC standard).

txStartTime.description: Transmit start time of a contact (ISO 8601 UTC standard).

txEndTime.description: Transmit end time of a contact (ISO 8601 UTC standard).

errorMessage.description: Any error message while scheduling a contact.

maximumElevationDegrees.description: Maximum elevation of the antenna during the contact in decimal degrees.

startAzimuthDegrees.description: Azimuth of the antenna at the start of the contact in decimal degrees.

endAzimuthDegrees.description: Azimuth of the antenna at the end of the contact in decimal degrees.

startElevationDegrees.description: Spacecraft elevation above the horizon at contact start.

endElevationDegrees.description: Spacecraft elevation above the horizon at contact end.

antennaConfiguration.description: The configuration associated with the allocated antenna.

destinationIp.description: The destination IP a packet can be sent to. This would for example be the TCP endpoint you would send data to.

items.description: The source IP a packet can have when being sent. You need to make sure you accept data from all these IPs in your application.

contactProfile.description: The reference to the contact profile resource.

provisioningState.description: The current state of the resource's creation, deletion, or modification.

minimumViableContactDuration.description: Minimum viable contact duration in ISO 8601 format. Used for listing the available contacts with a spacecraft at a given ground station.

minimumElevationDegrees.description: Minimum viable elevation for the contact in decimal degrees. Used for listing the available contacts with a spacecraft at a given ground station.

eventHubUri.description: ARM resource identifier of the Event Hub used for telemetry. Requires granting Orbital Resource Provider the rights to send telemetry into the hub.

networkConfiguration.description: Network configuration of customer virtual network.

subnetId.description: ARM resource identifier of the subnet delegated to the Microsoft.Orbital/orbitalGateways. Needs to be at least a class C subnet, and should not have any IP created in it.

thirdPartyConfigurations.description: Third-party mission configuration of the Contact Profile. Describes RF links, modem processing, and IP endpoints.

links.description: Links of the Contact Profile. Describes RF links, modem processing, and IP endpoints.

ContactProfilesProperties.description: List of Contact Profile Resource Properties.

value.description: A list of contact profile resources in a resource group.

nextLink.description: The URL to get the next set of results.

ContactProfileListResult.description: Response for the ListContactProfiles API service call.

modulationConfiguration.description: Copy of the modem configuration file such as Kratos QRadio. Only valid for uplink directions. If provided, the modem connects to the customer endpoint and accepts commands from the customer instead of a VITA.49 stream.

demodulationConfiguration.description: Copy of the modem configuration file such as Kratos QRadio or Kratos QuantumRx. Only valid for downlink directions. If provided, the modem connects to the customer endpoint and sends demodulated data instead of a VITA.49 stream.

gainOverTemperature.description: Gain to noise temperature in db/K. It is the required G/T by the customer. Not used yet.

eirpdBW.description: Effective Isotropic Radiated Power (EIRP) in dBW. It is the required EIRP by the customer. Not used yet.

properties.description: Properties of the contact profile resource.

ContactProfile.description: Customer creates a Contact Profile Resource, which will contain all of the configurations required for scheduling a contact.

ContactParameters.description: Parameters that define the contact resource.

contactProfile.description: The reference to the contact profile resource.

startTime.description: Start time of a contact (ISO 8601 UTC standard).

endTime.description: End time of a contact (ISO 8601 UTC standard).

value.description: A list of contact resources in a resource group.

nextLink.description: The URL to get the next set of results.

ContactListResult.description: Response for the ListContacts API service call.

maximumElevationDegrees.description: Maximum elevation of the antenna during the contact in decimal degrees.

txStartTime.description: Time at which antenna transmit will be enabled (ISO 8601 UTC standard).

txEndTime.description: Time at which antenna transmit will be disabled (ISO 8601 UTC standard).

rxStartTime.description: Earliest time to receive a signal (ISO 8601 UTC standard).

rxEndTime.description: Time to lost receiving a signal (ISO 8601 UTC standard).

startAzimuthDegrees.description: Azimuth of the antenna at the start of the contact in decimal degrees.

endAzimuthDegrees.description: Azimuth of the antenna at the end of the contact in decimal degrees.

startElevationDegrees.description: Spacecraft elevation above the horizon at contact start.

endElevationDegrees.description: Spacecraft elevation above the horizon at contact end.

Contact.description: Customer creates a contact resource for a spacecraft resource.

nextLink.description: The URL to get the next set of results.

AvailableContactsListResult.description: Response for the ListAvailableContacts API service call.

spacecraft.description: The reference to the spacecraft resource.

AvailableContacts.description: Customer retrieves list of Available Contacts for a spacecraft resource. Later, one of the available contact can be selected to create a contact.

value.description: A list of ground station resources.

nextLink.description: The URL to get the next set of results.

AvailableGroundStationListResult.description: Response for the AvailableGroundStations API service call.

properties.description: The properties bag for this resource.

AvailableGroundStation.description: Ground Stations available to schedule Contacts.

longitudeDegrees.description: Longitude of the ground station in decimal degrees.

latitudeDegrees.description: Latitude of the ground station in decimal degrees.

releaseMode.description: Release Status of a ground station.

value.description: A list of Azure Resource IDs.

nextLink.description: The URL to get the next set of results.

ResourceIdListResult.description: Response for an API service call that lists the resource IDs of resources associated with another resource.

ProvisioningState.description: The current state of the resource's creation, deletion, or modification.

startTime.description: The operation start time (ISO 8601 UTC standard).

endTime.description: The operation end time (ISO 8601 UTC standard).

value.description: A list of results when the operation returns multiple results.

nextLink.description: The URL to get the next set of results.

missionConfiguration.description: Name of string referencing the configuration describing contact set-up for a particular mission. Expected values are those which have been created in collaboration with the partner network.

skipTokenParameter.name: $skiptoken
skipTokenParameter.description: An opaque string that the resource provider uses to skip over previously-returned results. This is used when a previous list operation call returned a partial result. If a previous response contains a nextLink element, the value of the nextLink element will include a skiptoken parameter that specifies a starting point to use for subsequent calls.
